Package camzup.pfriendly

Interface IYup2

All Superinterfaces:
IUp
All Known Implementing Classes:
Yup2, YupJ2
public interface IYup2 extends IUp
Maintains consistent behavior across 2D renderers that extend different branches of PGraphics, such as PGraphics2D and PGraphicsJava2D.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final float
    DEFAULT_ROT
    The default camera rotation in radians.
    static final float
    DEFAULT_ZOOM_X
    The default camera horizontal zoom.
    static final float
    DEFAULT_ZOOM_Y
    The default camera vertical zoom.
    static final float
    GRID_FAC
    Factor by which a grid's count is scaled when dimensions are not supplied.

      Parameters:
      ap0 - the first anchor point
      cp0 - the first control point
      cp1 - the second control point
      ap1 - the second anchor point

      cp1 - the second control point
      ap1 - the next anchor point

    • moveTo

      default void moveTo(Vec2 locNew, float step)
      Moves the renderer's camera to a given location and updates the camera. Uses clamped linear interpolation, so the step should be smoothed prior to calling this function.
      Parameters:
      locNew - the new location
      step - the step
      See Also:
      • getLocX()
      • getLocY()
      • moveTo(float, float)

    • ray

      default void ray(float xOrig, float yOrig, float xDir, float yDir, float dLen)
      Displays a ray, i.e., an origin point and a direction. The display length of the direction is dictated by an input.
      Parameters:
      xOrig - the x origin
      yOrig - the y origin
      xDir - the x direction
      yDir - the y direction
      dLen - the display length

    • ray

      default void ray(float xOrig, float yOrig, float xDir, float yDir, float dLen, float lnwgt, float oWeight, float dWeight)
      Displays a ray, i.e., an origin point and a direction. The display length of the direction is dictated by an input.
      Parameters:
      xOrig - the x origin
      yOrig - the y origin
      xDir - the x direction
      yDir - the y direction
      dLen - the display length
      lnwgt - the line weight
      oWeight - the origin stroke weight
      dWeight - the direction stroke weight

      • camera(float, float, float, float, float)

    • rollTo

      default void rollTo(float radians, float step)
      Eases the renderer camera to a roll angle by a step in [0.0, 1.0] . Updates the camera. Uses clamped interpolation to the nearest angle.
      Parameters:
      radians - the angle in radians
      step - the step
      See Also:
      • Utils.modRadians(float)
      • rollTo(float)

    • screen

      Vec2 screen(Vec2 source, Vec2 target)
      Finds the screen position of a point in the world.

      More efficient than calling PApplet.screenX(float, float, float) and PApplet.screenY(float, float, float) separately. However, it is advisable to work with the renderer matrix directly.
      Parameters:
      source - the source coordinate
      target - the target coordinate
      Returns:
      the screen coordinate

    • screenX

      float screenX(float x, float y)
      Takes a two-dimensional x, y position and returns the x value for where it will appear on a two-dimensional screen. This is inefficient, use screen(Vec2, Vec2) instead.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      Returns:
      the screen x coordinate

    • screenX

      default float screenX(Vec2 v)
      Takes a two-dimensional position and returns the x value for where it will appear on a two-dimensional screen. This is inefficient, use screen(Vec2, Vec2) instead.
      Parameters:
      v - the position
      Returns:
      the screen y coordinate
      See Also:
      • YupJ2.screen(Vec2, Vec2)

    • screenY

      float screenY(float x, float y)
      Takes a two-dimensional x, y position and returns the y value for where it will appear on a two-dimensional screen. This is inefficient, use screen(Vec2, Vec2) instead.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      Returns:
      the screen y coordinate
      See Also:
      • YupJ2.screen(Vec2, Vec2)

    • screenY

      See Also:

    • zoomTo

      default void zoomTo(float w, float h)
      Zooms the renderer's camera to a target scale and updates the camera. Neither width nor height should be zero.
      Parameters:
      w - the width
      h - the height
      See Also:
      • getLocX()
      • getLocY()
      • getRoll()

    • zoomTo

      default void zoomTo(Vec2 scaleNew)
      Zooms the renderer's camera to a target scale and updates the camera. Neither width nor height should be zero.
      Parameters:
      scaleNew - the new scale
      See Also:
      • zoomTo(float, float)

    • zoomTo

      default void zoomTo(Vec2 scaleNew, float step)
      Zooms the renderer's camera to a target scale and updates the camera. Neither width nor height should be zero. Uses clamped linear interpolation, so the step should be smoothed prior to calling this function.
      Parameters:
      scaleNew - the new scale
      step - the step
      See Also:
      • getZoomX()
      • getZoomY()
      • zoomTo(float, float)

    • mouse

      renderer - the renderer
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the mouse coordinate
      See Also:
      • Utils.div(float, float)
      • getLocX()
      • getLocY()

    • mouse1s

      static Vec2 mouse1s(processing.core.PApplet parent, Vec2 target)
      Gets a mouse within a unit square, where either component may be in the range [-1.0, 1.0]. The mouse's y coordinate is flipped. (This is not a normalized vector.)
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent applet
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the mouse
      See Also:
      • Utils.clamp01(float)

    • mouse1u

      static Vec2 mouse1u(processing.core.PApplet parent, Vec2 target)
      Gets a mouse within the range [0.0, 1.0]. The mouse's y coordinate is flipped.
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent applet
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the mouse

    • svgBackground

      static String svgBackground(IYup2 renderer)
      Generates an SVG rectangle element to replicate the renderer's background. Assumes that the background is opaque, i.e., has an alpha channel of 1.0 . Returns a String.
      Parameters:
      renderer - the renderer
      Returns:
      the string
      See Also:
      • IUp.getWidth()
      • IUp.getHeight()
      • Color.toHexWeb(StringBuilder, int)
      • IUp.getBackground()

      Returns:
      the string
